Expectation1: Support each other emotionally during tough times
Situation1: One sibling has just received some very difficult news and is deeply distressed by it.
Expectation2: Show love and kindness to others, following the teachings of Jesus
Situation2: They offer small gestures of kindness in daily interactions
Story:
I sat on the edge of my bed, phone pressed to my ear, listening to my brother’s shaky voice as he told me about losing his job. He was devastated, and I could hear the tears he was trying to hide. As his sibling, I knew he needed me to be there for him, to listen, to comfort, to remind him that he wasn’t alone. But just an hour earlier, I had promised to help at the church’s community dinner, where I was supposed to greet guests and offer a warm smile to everyone who walked in—showing kindness, as my faith teaches me.

My brother’s pain tugged at my heart, but so did the thought of letting down the people at church who were counting on me. I wanted to be the sibling who dropped everything to support family, but I also wanted to be the Christian who showed love to strangers, just as Jesus would. The weight of both expectations pressed on me, and I felt torn, wishing I could be in two places at once, wrestling with the fear of disappointing someone no matter what I chose.
